prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Manfred von Karma
Description: My mentor who has never known defeat in 35 years. A legendary prosecutor.
Character 1
Name: Byrne Faraday
Description: Prosecutor in Embassy staff killing case. Accused by Rell of being the Yatagarasu.
Character 2
Name: Deid Mann
Description: Cohdopian Embassy staff member. Was gunned down in front of Embassy by Rell.
Character 3
Name: Mack Rell
Description: Embassy staff killing suspect. Arrested on suspicion for the handgun he was carrying.
Character 4
Name: Yatagarasu
Description: Real identity is unknown, but claims to be a noble thief. Infiltrated the Embassy.
Character 5
Name: ??? → Kay Faraday
Description: A girl with a balloon. During the recess, she asked me to change some coins for her.
Character 6
Name: The Judge
Description: Judge in Embassy staff killing case.
Character 7
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: New rookie detective at the precinct. First crime scene. Seems very enthusiastic.
Character 8
Name: Calisto Yew
Description: Lawyer of embassy staff killing defendant, Rell. I was to battle her in court.
Character 9
Name: Tyrell Badd
Description: Eagle-eyed homicide det. Was called in to be expert witness on the Yatagarasu case.
Character 10
Name: Manny Coachen
Description: Cohdopian Embassy staff member. He was the suspect in the KG-8 Incident.
Character 11
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: My mentor's daughter. Studying to be a prosecutor in Germany, back on break.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. My mentor said it was more chic to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: KG-8 Incident Overview
Description: Received from my mentor as reference about KG-8. [info] The headline reads: Cohdopian Embassy staff Member, Manny Coachen, Found Not Guity!
Evidence 2
Name: Det. Gumshoe's Testimony
Description: Was in hall on guard duty. Other than gunshot, didn't hear a sign of a struggle.
Evidence 3
Name: Handgun
Description: Was Faraday's evidence from Embassy staff killing case. It was found in his hand. Found in Faraday's hand. Bullet that killed Rell was fired from a few yards away.
Evidence 4
Name: Knife
Description: I believe Faraday brought this as evidence. It was found in Rell's hand. Weapon used to kill Faraday. Has the secret ability to change into key the Yatagarasu sent.
Evidence 5
Name: Crime Scene Notes
Description: Notes pertaining to Byrne Faraday and Mack Rell. [info] Victim
Byrne Faraday (Age: 40)
Mack Rell (Age: 32)

Time of Death
September 10
Approximately 4 PM
Discovered immediately after a gunshot was heard.


Remarks About the Bodies
Faraday died of a knife stab to the chest.
Rell died of a bullet wound to the chest. There is no gunpowder burn on his clothes, suggesting he was shot from a few yards away.
Evidence 6
Name: Plastic Bag
Description: One of the bags strewn on floor of Lobby No. 2. Has Faraday's blood on it.
Evidence 7
Name: Mr. Faraday's Fountain Pen
Description: Fountain pen used by the left-handed Faraday. Looks like it has a quality nib.
Evidence 8
Name: Annual Bonus Envelope
Description: Det. Gumshoe's annual bonus of $5. Literally had no money on him until he cashed this.
Evidence 9
Name: Swiss Roll
Description: Swiss roll dropped by the mysterious young girl. Says "Courthouse Special" on it. Swiss roll dropped by the mysterious young girl. It's priced at 2 for $6. Detective Gumshoe and Kay bought this Swiss roll together.
Evidence 10
Name: Det. Badd's Testimony
Description: He heard the gunshot right before the trial was about to start again.
Evidence 11
Name: Det. Gumshoe's Fingerprints
Description: Left on the hallway bench. Black smudge emits the scent of sweet sugar. Left on the hallway bench. Det. Gumshoe apparently sat here as he ate a Swiss roll.
Evidence 12
Name: Balloon Piece
Description: I just know I've seen a pink balloon around... Found on windowsill of the hallway window. Balloon popped by Kay. The Judge misheard its popping for a gunshot.
Evidence 13
Name: Promise Notebook
Description: Exchange diary between Mr. Faraday and Kay.
Evidence 14
Name: Ms. Yew's Perfume
Description: Perfume given to Badd by Yew. Same perfume as the one spilled in Lobby No. 1.
Evidence 15
Name: Mr. Faraday's Organizer
Description: Faraday wrote his strategy for winning in here.
Evidence 16
Name: Yatagarasu's Key
Description: Photo of key the Yatagarasu sent. Unusual shape. Photo of the key the Yatagarasu sent. Turns into knife.
Evidence 17
Name: Surveillance Video
Description: Video of the Embassy staff member's murder. Gunshot is especially impactful.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Mr. Faraday's death was instantaneous, while Mr. Rell survived for a short time.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 1
Testimony: From this, it is obvious that Mr. Faraday died after he shot Mr. Rell.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 2
Testimony: And Mr. Rell, while on the brink of death, stole Mr. Faraday's knife and stabbed him.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 3
Testimony: They struggled, and Mr. Rell used the last of his strength to counterattack Mr. Faraday.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 4
Testimony: Those are the facts of this case.
Person: Franziska

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Let's analyze the testimonies from Franziska, specifically Testimony 3: "They struggled, and Mr. Rell used the last of his strength to counterattack Mr. Faraday."

Now, looking at Evidence 2 (Det. Gumshoe's Testimony): "Was in hall on guard duty. Other than gunshot, didn't hear a sign of a struggle."

Franziska claims there was a struggle, but Det. Gumshoe, guarding the hall, says he didn't hear any signs of a struggle, only a gunshot. These statements are contradictory: if there was a struggle, Gumshoe should have heard something.

cot: Testimony 3 by Franziska states: "That fact indicates that they attacked each other at the same time from close range." However, Evidence 5 (Crime Scene Notes) states regarding Mack Rell: "Rell died of a bullet wound to the chest. There is no gunpowder burn on his clothes, suggesting he was shot from a few yards away." This means the shooting was not from close range, and thus contradicts the "close range" claim of the testimony.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: There's no one out there with a motive to kill both Mr. Faraday and Mr. Rell.
Person: Yew
Testimony 1
Testimony: All you really have to establish is that someone had a grudge against one of the two men.
Person: Yew
Testimony 2
Testimony: Mr. Rell, who happened to be there, became a witness to Mr. Faraday's murder.
Person: Yew
Testimony 3
Testimony: Therefore, he was killed out of necessity, and set up to look like they had killed each other.
Person: Yew

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Testimony 3 by Yew claims that Rell was killed and "set up to look like they had killed each other." This suggests that the scene was made to look like a murder-suicide or reciprocal murder at close range, which usually would involve firing at close quarters, creating a gunpowder burn.

However, Evidence 5 (Crime Scene Notes) explicitly states that "There is no gunpowder burn on [Rell's] clothes, suggesting he was shot from a few yards away." This directly contradicts the idea that Rell and Faraday killed each other at close quarters—such a setup would almost always leave gunpowder residue. Thus, the forensics counter Yew's claim about the setup.
